The delicate lifestyle of the speaker [a: Lotus ponds made just for the speaker
Sandalwood from Kāsī used for clothing
A white parasol held over the speaker night and day
Three stilt longhouses for different seasons
Entertained by musicians during the rainy season
The consequences of being intoxicated wi: Intoxicated with the vanity of youth, an uneducated ordinary person does bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
Intoxicated with the vanity of health, an uneducated ordinary person does bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
Intoxicated with the vanity of life, an uneducated ordinary person does bad things by way of body, speech, and mind.
When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
The speaker's understanding and mastery: The speaker understood the reality without attachments
The speaker mastered all vanities, including the vanities of health, youth, and life
The speaker saw renunciation as sanctuary
Zeal sprang up in the speaker as they looked to extinguishment.
